Jury Nullification.definition: the acquitting of a defendant by a jury in disregard of the judge's instructions and contrary to the jury's findings of fact NOTE

1.1: the acquitting of a defendant by a jury in disregard of the judge's instructions and contrary to the jury's findings of fact
1.note: Jury nullification is most likely to occur when a jury is sympathetic toward a defendant or regards the law under which the defendant is charged with disfavor. Except for a statutory requirement to the contrary, a jury does not have to be instructed on the possibility of jury nullification.
